Authors:
Putarak Chomnunti, Thida Win Ko Ko, lei cai, Ekachai
Chukeatirote, Rampai Kodsueb, E. B. Gareth Jones, Bahkali Ali Hassan,
Hang Chen, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Phylogeny of Chaetothyriaceae in northern Thailand including
three new species.
Keywords:
Ceramothyrium, Chaetothyriaceae, Chaetothyrium, LSU,
Phaeosaccardinula, Phylogeny.
Abstract:
During a recent study, unusual taxa of epiphyllous
ascomycota belonging to Chaetothyriaceae (Eurotiomycetes) were collected
in northern Thailand. This family is poorly understood both in of
morphological characters and there have been few phylogenetic studies.
This paper deals with three new species, i.e.Â Ceramothyrium
thailandicum, Chaetothyrium brischofiacola and Phaeosaccardinula ficus
which are fully described and illustrated. A DNA sequence analyses of
LSU rDNA genes shows that the new species cluster in the
Chaetothyriaceae. This paper adds six sequences for Chaetothyriaceae to
GenBank providing much needed data for the family.
